physical_parameter.description: Each Physical Parameter record defines a MIP variable name, associated with a CF Standard Name.

fldDarr37kY7ENAyq.description: The units in which the variable is to be measured, as a short text string. They must conform with the canonical units of the CF Standard Name.
fldDarr37kY7ENAyq.name: Units

fldSTx9uTteWCWVzb.description: Information on the provenance of the specification of this variables.
fldSTx9uTteWCWVzb.name: Provenance

fldu0Nw0f07mbj7ov.description: CF Standard Names (copied into data request to facilitate validation, particularly validation of consistency of definition in the CF standard with usage in the data request).
fldu0Nw0f07mbj7ov.name: CF Standard Name

fldyferIJXJn8c0Q1.description: Free text comment about processing of the variable.
fldyferIJXJn8c0Q1.name: Processing Comment

physical_parameter.name: Physical Parameter

rec2AcR9DaKYmQMyC.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.
rec2AcR9DaKYmQMyC.name: o2
rec2AcR9DaKYmQMyC.title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration

rec2qX17x1y7b2uSY.description: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface
rec2qX17x1y7b2uSY.name: tauu
rec2qX17x1y7b2uSY.title: Surface Downward Eastward Wind Stress

rec3Lghsa4NTbMrcp.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
rec3Lghsa4NTbMrcp.name: prra
rec3Lghsa4NTbMrcp.title: Rainfall Flux

rec4qAz25RefVajgF.description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: max")
rec4qAz25RefVajgF.name: tasmax
rec4qAz25RefVajgF.title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature

rec4vw328fZmHdeCH.description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.
rec4vw328fZmHdeCH.name: tslsi
rec4vw328fZmHdeCH.title: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice

rec6oqXA505xtXT9O.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
rec6oqXA505xtXT9O.name: lai
rec6oqXA505xtXT9O.title: Leaf Area Index

rec6zrdIbrYRZbIRM.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
rec6zrdIbrYRZbIRM.name: hur
rec6zrdIbrYRZbIRM.title: Relative Humidity

rec7Xns239jr3hLPH.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
rec7Xns239jr3hLPH.name: mlotst
rec7Xns239jr3hLPH.title: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

rec7z2loiUHQJgtQA.comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.
rec7z2loiUHQJgtQA.description: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)
rec7z2loiUHQJgtQA.name: bigthetao
rec7z2loiUHQJgtQA.processing_comment: This variable should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
rec7z2loiUHQJgtQA.title: Sea Water Conservative Temperature

rec91AmllWC6qN2Kh.description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
rec91AmllWC6qN2Kh.name: cli
rec91AmllWC6qN2Kh.title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Ice

rec9WbeuzlnAx4b9c.description: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
rec9WbeuzlnAx4b9c.name: calcos
rec9WbeuzlnAx4b9c.title: Surface Calcite Concentration

recAGKQ3qhB6rcqoe.comments: Incorrect statement about inverse barometer effects of sea-ice
recAGKQ3qhB6rcqoe.description: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
recAGKQ3qhB6rcqoe.name: zos
recAGKQ3qhB6rcqoe.title: Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

recBywor8JZMPC7Eu.description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
recBywor8JZMPC7Eu.name: vo
recBywor8JZMPC7Eu.title: Sea Water Y Velocity

recCgv1ra4YzGOEBl.description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
recCgv1ra4YzGOEBl.name: tauuo
recCgv1ra4YzGOEBl.title: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress

recCoW8yy8g5E63P1.name: zossq
recCoW8yy8g5E63P1.title: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

recCsKn6vadxXDfab.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
recCsKn6vadxXDfab.name: uo
recCsKn6vadxXDfab.title: Sea Water X Velocity

recDDLVlCusAhEwiL.description: The bulk water content retained by the soil at -33 J/kg of suction pressure, expressed as mass per unit land area; report as missing where there is no land
recDDLVlCusAhEwiL.name: mrsofc
recDDLVlCusAhEwiL.title: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)

recG4f3gtqRp3srnd.description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
recG4f3gtqRp3srnd.name: tauvo
recG4f3gtqRp3srnd.title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress

recHbQKPCOpLSMUBQ.description: A variable with the standard name of region contains strings which indicate geographical regions. These strings must be chosen from the standard region list.
recHbQKPCOpLSMUBQ.name: basin
recHbQKPCOpLSMUBQ.title: Region Selection Index

recI3SgZ2eTD8wjtZ.description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
recI3SgZ2eTD8wjtZ.name: clt
recI3SgZ2eTD8wjtZ.title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage

recIBbUhnYnSwcFuj.description: Northward component of the near surface wind
recIBbUhnYnSwcFuj.name: vas
recIBbUhnYnSwcFuj.title: Northward Near-Surface Wind

recIMsy62B6kBGAfF.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
recIMsy62B6kBGAfF.name: hfss
recIMsy62B6kBGAfF.title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux

recIlGUXAQkHdi2Zk.description: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere
recIlGUXAQkHdi2Zk.name: ts
recIlGUXAQkHdi2Zk.title: Surface Temperature

recJMKUt96nZH4VCo.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
recJMKUt96nZH4VCo.name: rsds
recJMKUt96nZH4VCo.title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation

recJMUnit2WUBfUzz.description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations
recJMUnit2WUBfUzz.name: rsdscs
recJMUnit2WUBfUzz.title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation

recJXyhl7OKdwvnLj.description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: min")
recJXyhl7OKdwvnLj.name: tasmin
recJXyhl7OKdwvnLj.title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature

recK7QOrj9b1eBwBM.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
recK7QOrj9b1eBwBM.name: sos
recK7QOrj9b1eBwBM.title: Sea Surface Salinity

recKF1m7SKS4jslis.description: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)
recKF1m7SKS4jslis.name: sisnthick
recKF1m7SKS4jslis.title: Snow Thickness

recLJBIERyomFklC6.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
recLJBIERyomFklC6.name: siconc
recLJBIERyomFklC6.title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Ocean Grid)

recLaT8DxhFjNGEcs.description: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.
recLaT8DxhFjNGEcs.name: areacella
recLaT8DxhFjNGEcs.title: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables

recLcTjdFgY881BMw.description: Sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
recLcTjdFgY881BMw.name: calc
recLcTjdFgY881BMw.title: Calcite Concentration

recMWmpLknlDeFO02.description: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)
recMWmpLknlDeFO02.name: evspsbl
recMWmpLknlDeFO02.title: Evaporation Including Sublimation and Transpiration

recMXPJmwDKgYxaGx.description: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.
recMXPJmwDKgYxaGx.name: snw
recMXPJmwDKgYxaGx.title: Surface Snow Amount

recMaWo0hYmG98KXI.description: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
recMaWo0hYmG98KXI.name: clwvi
recMaWo0hYmG98KXI.title: Condensed Water Path

recMz4uOAC8skoKzp.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
recMz4uOAC8skoKzp.name: zg
recMz4uOAC8skoKzp.title: Geopotential Height

recMzBZrzlpb3MulX.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
recMzBZrzlpb3MulX.name: mrsol
recMzBZrzlpb3MulX.title: Total Water Content of Soil Layer

recNm41PZ4MQZcTrT.description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.
recNm41PZ4MQZcTrT.name: sftlf
recNm41PZ4MQZcTrT.title: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)

recNuMfGeavvrPQ53.description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by ocean.
recNuMfGeavvrPQ53.name: sftof
recNuMfGeavvrPQ53.title: Sea Area Percentage

recO4KhwcuYVTQGco.description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid cell.
recO4KhwcuYVTQGco.name: slthick
recO4KhwcuYVTQGco.title: Thickness of Soil Layers

recO8f7x8pKLbrTnS.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
recO8f7x8pKLbrTnS.name: rsus
recO8f7x8pKLbrTnS.title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation

recOSkN2GvF2rXdtw.description: Y-ward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.
recOSkN2GvF2rXdtw.name: vmo
recOSkN2GvF2rXdtw.title: Ocean Mass Y Transport

recQb7OKObc8nERaQ.description: Upward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.
recQb7OKObc8nERaQ.name: wmo
recQb7OKObc8nERaQ.title: Upward Ocean Mass Transport

recSj7IlWJGSClhc9.description: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).
recSj7IlWJGSClhc9.name: mrros
recSj7IlWJGSClhc9.title: Surface Runoff

recT8DQATGQI5HetK.description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.
recT8DQATGQI5HetK.name: rsutcs
recT8DQATGQI5HetK.title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation

recTjkLYzxVpUVxiK.description: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
recTjkLYzxVpUVxiK.name: clivi
recTjkLYzxVpUVxiK.title: Ice Water Path

recU3lrkXBHzDdoVv.description: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
recU3lrkXBHzDdoVv.name: aragos
recU3lrkXBHzDdoVv.title: Surface Aragonite Concentration

recUuj1LUGFtVbA7Y.description: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
recUuj1LUGFtVbA7Y.name: prsn
recUuj1LUGFtVbA7Y.title: Snowfall Flux

recUxGWdyaCbQgKdU.description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates
recUxGWdyaCbQgKdU.name: ps
recUxGWdyaCbQgKdU.title: Surface Air Pressure

recVmyFq2GS7Xjj4B.comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.
recVmyFq2GS7Xjj4B.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.
recVmyFq2GS7Xjj4B.name: masscello
recVmyFq2GS7Xjj4B.processing_comment: If constant, report as a fixed configuration field, otherwise report as time varying.
recVmyFq2GS7Xjj4B.title: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area

recWAKOyguBXUQP5V.description: Ocean bathymetry.   Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.
recWAKOyguBXUQP5V.name: deptho
recWAKOyguBXUQP5V.title: Sea Floor Depth Below Geoid

recWrFmeU5w0UHLC7.description: includes both liquid and solid phases
recWrFmeU5w0UHLC7.name: pr
recWrFmeU5w0UHLC7.title: Precipitation

recXNnpvyHHMDvEZx.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.
recXNnpvyHHMDvEZx.name: so
recXNnpvyHHMDvEZx.title: Sea Water Salinity

recXV9dTKN44LjkPn.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell
recXV9dTKN44LjkPn.name: sitimefrac
recXV9dTKN44LjkPn.title: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice

recZYVgHKnlI1Nzl9.description: negative log of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
recZYVgHKnlI1Nzl9.name: ph
recZYVgHKnlI1Nzl9.title: pH

recaSUZAogXdmRNbv.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
recaSUZAogXdmRNbv.name: va
recaSUZAogXdmRNbv.title: Northward Wind

recaVRA3Xju2gaYbk.description: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as \*missing\* where the land fraction is 0.
recaVRA3Xju2gaYbk.name: rootd
recaVRA3Xju2gaYbk.title: Maximum Root Depth

recc0fTD0yYzZEO6V.description: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
recc0fTD0yYzZEO6V.name: clw
recc0fTD0yYzZEO6V.title: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water

reccXxhCp31DlQ4P6.description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
reccXxhCp31DlQ4P6.name: zostoga
reccXxhCp31DlQ4P6.title: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

recd2QlEHviYlZfMf.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)
recd2QlEHviYlZfMf.name: sithick
recd2QlEHviYlZfMf.title: Sea Ice Thickness

recdG5LgZjoehaZcK.description: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.
recdG5LgZjoehaZcK.name: mrfso
recdG5LgZjoehaZcK.title: Soil Frozen Water Content

recdL4o70pSbLgr2R.description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere
recdL4o70pSbLgr2R.name: rsdt
recdL4o70pSbLgr2R.title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation

recdtbHo6cGcbLTn2.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
recdtbHo6cGcbLTn2.name: tos
recdtbHo6cGcbLTn2.title: Sea Surface Temperature

rece8NCMHeYJ0Gf86.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
rece8NCMHeYJ0Gf86.name: hurs
rece8NCMHeYJ0Gf86.title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity

receqwm7ezIdEc2j5.description: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
receqwm7ezIdEc2j5.name: prc
receqwm7ezIdEc2j5.title: Convective Precipitation

recfembjlk8OdCJyA.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
recfembjlk8OdCJyA.name: rlds
recfembjlk8OdCJyA.title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation

recfhPQHvfBSrJKxF.description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column
recfhPQHvfBSrJKxF.name: prw
recfhPQHvfBSrJKxF.title: Water Vapor Path

recfjreFM7dLfTLfU.description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
recfjreFM7dLfTLfU.name: hus
recfjreFM7dLfTLfU.title: Specific Humidity

recfph4Didj1vDCN7.description: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.
recfph4Didj1vDCN7.name: evspsblveg
recfph4Didj1vDCN7.title: Evaporation from Canopy

recg0rpTcMsUvAMXO.description: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
recg0rpTcMsUvAMXO.name: mrro
recg0rpTcMsUvAMXO.title: Total Runoff

recgmGZ50FDqMq60G.description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
recgmGZ50FDqMq60G.name: tnkebto
recgmGZ50FDqMq60G.title: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

rech7VscQrqCcl0cW.description: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

rech7VscQrqCcl0cW.title: Omega (=dp/dt)

recjjP4F0GjDpNrgR.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
recjjP4F0GjDpNrgR.name: rlus
recjjP4F0GjDpNrgR.title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation

recvDSSDF5RyJGvID.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

recvzteipWn3yq8CU.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

recvzteipWn3yq8CU.title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux

rec7dMFHzSJRjAmi1.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
rec7dMFHzSJRjAmi1.title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
